name: Chromoblastomycosis
chief_complaint: I have these slowly growing, crusty lesions on my foot that won't heal
physical_findings: verrucous plaques with black dots (sclerotic bodies)
prognosis: chronic progression with high recurrence; early treatment improves outcomes but complete cure is difficult
description: A chronic subcutaneous mycosis caused by traumatic implantation of dematiaceous fungi, characterized by slow-growing verrucous lesions that may evolve into cauliflower-like tumors. Endemic in tropical regions and associated with agricultural work.
